An interrogative sentence is one that asks a direct question
An imperative sentence is one that makes a command or an entreaty
A declarative sentence is a sentence that makes a statement of fact. The statement may be true or false. It may also be in the affirmative or in the negative.
An *Exclamatory sentence* is a sentence that is used to express sudden feelings or emotions.
Words are generally categorized into *open* and *closed* classes.
*Preposition* is an example of closed class.
